description: From Hebrew בֵּית אֵל‎ (beth el, literally “house of God”). See also  Bethel on  Wikipedia.Wikipedia .

entries.meaning: A chapel, especially one for sailors, converted from an old ship.
examples: Six thousand of this number constitute the seafaring portion of the floating population of New York and Brooklyn, and for their particular accommodation there are, of mission stations and bethels, fifteen places that invite the sailor to hear the Word of God.
